content.description: Starts on good holds in the middle of the face of the Old Man Boulder. Moves up and left and tops out around where the bolted anchors are. Crux is probably moving past the pictured gaston to some tougher holds near the top. Top out can be sketchy because of dirt and plants.
content.protection: We bouldered it. Landing on sand. Can also be top roped. Scramble up the back side of the boulder and set up the top rope on a three bolt anchor.
content.location: The problem is on the ocean facing side of the Old Man Boulder at Stinson.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on a high hold. Use the crack below the big obvious bulge and the bulge to climb up. You can sit on the rock once you get above this point and then hop down, or you can keep going and top out and use the backside to walk down. If anyone has info on the history of the route please share.
content.protection: Pads. A spotter if you plan on topping out.
content.location: Southwest arete between the V3 and the south face. Look for the bulge about 10-12 feet up and the match start on the corner.

content.description: Fun problem starting low on the south face of the Old Man Boulder. Climb up to your right with the finish wedged in the large crack in the rock. Can sit in the crack before the down climb.

Located in the corridor on the north facing side of the Old Man Boulder. Traverse right to left and/or left to right on the north face. For full value, traverse entirety of Old Man Boulder, i.e., south to west to north faces or vice versa (this would be significantly harder and increase the graded level).
